newsitem.title: USA: U Mich April prelim index ties record high - sources.
newsitem.headline: U Mich April prelim index ties record high - sources.

text.p: The University of Michigan's preliminary index of consumer sentiment for April tied the series' all-time high set in March 1984 at 101.0, market sources said on Friday.
"At 101.0, the index matches its level of March 1984, the record for the series since it started on a monthly basis in 1978," a market source told Reuters.
The University of Michigan, which releases its index only to paying subscribers, declined any comment on the data.

Financial market sources reported earlier on Friday the index rose to 101.0 in early April from 100.0 in March. The current conditions component surged to 116.7 from 109.8, while the expectations component slipped to 90.9 from 93.6.
"This is the first time the index registered back-to-back readings of 100 or higher. Record confidence implies the consumer will continue to fuel growth," the source added.

"This means a very small likelihood consumers will cut back on spending," said Conference Board economist Michael Boldin, who calculates the Leading Economic Indicators index of which the Michigan expectations index is a component.
